page.title: 13LANDSCAPE AROUND BERROW
page.content: The altitude of the land in this sector varies widely from the Southeast, only 17ms. above the ordnance datum, to the Northwest which rises to the summits of the Malvern Hills. The variation of altitude has given rise to extremely picturesque scenery on the slopes of the{hills, including ravines and terraces. Land on the lower slopes of the hills is heavily wooded with both timber and fruit{trees.}Below this the landscape is made up of small farms and hedged fields, solely an{agricultural}scene. The upper slopes support sheep while arable and pastureland dominate the lower ground.
